When the subject is still, in daylight, and you can hold the camera steady, the coolpix cameras all take great pictures.Nikon Coolpix L18 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Ruby Red)

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: H. Garza
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have been through so many...guess i'm too picky! It also arrived very quickly!

Reviews.Title: It didn't last a year
Reviews.Author: Wendy
Reviews.Content: It was a great camera and easy to use.  The photos and videos were good and the extra zoom was handy.  The camera was bought last Christmas, it didn't last a year.  It still takes photos, however it is diffucult, since the LCD screen went blank (and there's no eye hole).  Now I need to get another point and shoot- before Christmas.  Also, the cost of keeping up with the AA batteries was blah.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher G. Staton "Christopher"
Reviews.Content: I have this camera, in conjunction with an underwater housing for scuba diving.  Takes excellent pics and is extremely easy to use.  I also use it as a more portable backup to my Nikon D80 SLR digital.  Recently went on vacation to Vegas, taking both cameras, after the first day, I stored the D80 and only used this cool pix and received many compliments on the quality of my images.  No one could tell which pics were from the cool pix or from the D80. I will be buying at least one more of these as a backup in case mine fails..

Reviews.Title: Love my camera!
Reviews.Author: E. Harman
Reviews.Content: I got my camera at Christmas from my in-laws and it's been a fabulous camera to carry around in my purse for those moments when you wish you had a camera.  HOwever it's now September and the LCD screen has gone blank.  I've been told I'd have to replace my screen components but that will be around $100 for parts and labor.  Forget that!  I think that's what my in-laws paid for the darn thing.  Love my camera and am so bummed that it pooped out on me.  I'm going to go buy another one and stay away from this particular camera in fear that it will happen again.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: L. schultz "Moonshadow"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera Crisp clear shots and the zoom quality astounded me.  Very easy on screen instrutions.  My only negative comment was the computer disk was damaged on delivery

Reviews.Title: pictures are great but now defective
Reviews.Author: A. Eldridge
Reviews.Content: We loved this camera when we first bought it.  The pictures and videos of our new son came out great.  However, it is now having an issue with detecting the batteries (after less than a year of ownership).  Other reviewers mentioned that the camera used up batteries but I think the camera can no longer sense the true battery power.  I have tested the batteries and used them in other devices and they still have plenty of power but the camera says battery exhausted after only a few minutes.  I have not tried to contact Nikon, so perhaps they know about this problem and would fix it (however, most of the negative reviews indicated otherwise).

Reviews.Title: Good for general photos
Reviews.Author: Beauty&Brains;
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 2 years and taken hundreds of photos with it. I've taken with me on a deployment and to the beach and it still did great. The flash is somewhat tricky to get just right, you just have to experiment. There is a macro setting for super-close ups which will come out blurry if you dont use a tripod. The zoom is wonderful, just be careful not to zoom so much that you use the digital zoom, that will digitize your photos. In general it's great for photos of family and friends, not great for action or long distance.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Marko Ljutica "if i must"
Reviews.Content: as mentioned in previous reviews, this camera eats up the battery. after transferring my pictures into the computer, some pictures were cut in half, the result being a picture which was half blank grey and half the actual picture. i was so upset :(...

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase!
Reviews.Author: R. Joseph "Trinihibiscus"
Reviews.Content: Grerat purchase.  The clarity of the pictures is amazing!  The color is very elegant and above all the camera is so easy to use!

Reviews.Title: good all rounder
Reviews.Author: Michelle L. Yates "giroux321"
Reviews.Content: this is a good camera for everyday use.  the megapixels are enough to produce nice enlargements and its easy to tote around.  nice viewing screen

Reviews.Title: After 6 months - Mixed review - battery and memory issues
Reviews.Author: James J. Christopher
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before Christmas of 2008 and after being extremely happy with the price and quality I am now not so thrilled.  It has crashed twice costing me all the images on the internal Memory card (had to reformat the card) and it now burns through batteries at an insane rate - sometimes after only one or two hours use it will say "batteries are exhausted" and they need to be replaced - thee are expensive alkaline batteries.  I still love the look (mine is blue), the feel and the photos are very good but these other issues give me pause to recommend this camera - I am sure there are better available products that offer less hassle.  Oh and the Video images on this are very poor - no good enough for any use other than the most basic - video image very grainy and sound is bad.

Reviews.Title: great price but...
Reviews.Author: Maria Casita
Reviews.Content: I wanted an inexpensive camera to replace my broken expensive camera. I chose this one because it is extremely user friendly. I picked it up in the store and was able to use it without referring to a manual. The only problem is, you get what you pay for. It takes OK photos and I want good photos. I have chosen to leave my camera at home lately rather than be disappointed by my photo outcomes. Now I am shopping for another replacement camera so I guess I really did not save any money after all.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error! after 5 days of use!
Reviews.Author: J. Champion
Reviews.Content: This camera was used for 5 days and then it showed the Lens Error!  It took good pictures and was well taken care of (not dropped or anything).  I was so disappointed.  Must be some poor design or something for this to happen after only 5 days of use!

Reviews.Title: Great little digital for beginner
Reviews.Author: H. Steinhagen "H Steinhagen"
Reviews.Content: Big Screen, easy to use for 1st time digi user. Like it so much i ordered one as a gift for a family member.

Reviews.Title: DOES IT ALL VERY WELL AND MAKES MOVIES TOO; ARE YOU READY FOR YOUR CLOSE-UP?
Reviews.Author: C. Scanlon "least helpful reviewer"
Reviews.Content: I had leave the desert hermitage Saturday like every Saturday to go to town to wash clothes thirty miles away and buy celery and Mori-Nu Tofu, Silken Style, Extra Firm, 12.3-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 12) and the rest, and when I got there remembered I had an assignment to do for the newspaper, but left the Nikon D40 6.1MP Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6G ED II AF-S DX and 55-200mm f/4.5-5.6G ED AF-S DX Zoom-Nikkor Lens with 2 Nikon School DVD at home in the hermitage.I've used the D40 for a few years now and it is finally getting intuitive and I am finally figuring out how to do some of what it can do. I just wish I could afford a long lens. It is really a great camera, and very tolerant of my pushing the limits in low light. Recently I got some great night carnival shots taken and one published.So I get to town last Saturday and remembered I was supposed to do this VERY IMPORTANT assignment, and went to the place and discovered it was my only chance, that day, right then. Not next weekend; right then. They even offered to lend me their point-and-shoot and they offered to e-mail me the results, but then found out the p&s; had been sent back to the shop.No other choice but to go to the ubiquitous BIG BOX store and see what they had. Nothing special, until I saw my favorite brand name. I thought of going back to an Olympus, having used that brand years ago, but they take minicards not the full size SanDisk 2 GB SD Memory Card ( SDSDB-2048-A11, Retail Package).Then I saw the Nikon display, and, like, wow.Okay, so its ruby red . . . That is its only weak point (although the expectant lady at the Chinese food store said it was a great and a lucky color when she saw it while serving my steamed tofu). This camera can do more than you can ever use and more than you can imagine, and more than my beloved d40. For one thing it takes movies, well.For another thing it takes a full 8 megapixels, more than the d40. I could blow these pictures up further than the d40's, if such a thing as a photo lab still existed (Ok, so, ten megapixels is the standard now; we might say ten is the new 6.something).And it takes the SD card, so anywhere you are you can pull out a targus SDHC card reader, and slip open the L18's combination battery-SD card cover, and plug the card into any computer with a USB port and file your photos. And you can get SDHC cards big enough for your needs, a card which will far outlast the battery charge.I just feel really dicey about that battery latch. I used to snap their tooth off all of the time over twenty years ago on my great Canon AL-1 film SLR camera, and it brought out some sweat to my brow the first time I tried manipulating this one. It takes a snap and a slide, but it is no sweat once you get the hang of it.The strange thing is that old Canon AL-1 took triple AAA batteries in its full sized SLR, whereas this L18 micro-mini-camera takes double AA. In fact the bulk of the width here is due to the fat batteries. I was surprised, but much more is done electronically here than on the old SLR's.This tiny camera is under four inches long by under three inches tall by about exactly one inch thick, because of the batteries. Figure those dimensions while picking out a camera case, which you will want. Right now mine is wrapped up in a bandana and a Zip-lock bag, just like back in the tropical mountain rainforest twenty something years ago, but I definitely want a case to keep it in, to throw in a pocket and walk around, and no one knows what I'm packing, that I am ready to shoot pictures. Several are for sale here on the broad amazon, but carefully check the interior dimensions. I think I might settle on the Rokinon Digital Camera Weather Resistant Carry Case for Nikon Coolpix L16, L18, P50, P60, P5000, P5100, P6000, S7c, S9, S50, S50c, S51, S51c, S52c, S60, S200, S210, S500, S510, S520, S550, S560, S600, S610, S610c, S700, S710 Digital Cameras.That's another strong advantage over the full-sized DSLR hanging off one shoulder. This camera and case can slide into any pocket and no one knows it, but you are ready for anything.Too bad it is, well, so red.It takes movies. This tiny thing takes movies, with sound, saved right on to the SD card. AND it is HDSC compliant, which means you could probably load that SanDisk Ultra II 16GB/15MB SDHC Card in here and film for a good long time. I'll just be glad to get a 4gb card in here!Right now I have a 2 GB card in, and have it set to record still photos at the highest resolution, and that 2 GB card will hold over 375 shots. It will also hold over twenty minutes of movie. I am astonished, full of tech shock. Okay, so you're used to your mobile PHONE doing all of this, no sweat, but check out the resolution on this baby (My phone, by the way, only hangs on the wall and rings, except it never does, ring, but that is another story).This L18 has a three times optical zoom (which means it is not digitally manipulated to look closer - the lens itself is doing the zooming) handled with that tiny teeter totter switch W-T that point and shoot folk are accustomed to (I am used to turning the lens).This 8 megapixels is incredible. I took some shots at the assignment, and checked them on that full color monitor on the back (I want to get some of those protective screens, but wonder how they affect viewing) and was able to pan in very close with the on-board bells and whistles, and confirm that every hair was in focus.They were. This is incredible.For it to do ISO 1600 is another strong selling point for a photographer. You can count on shots by a bare light bulb or street lamp. By candle. I just want to find where I switch off the built in flash, which is also great, going out to 25 feet. This is incredible.Okay, so the anti-shake means the little elves inside can go what we used to call shutter-priority, setting a faster shutter speed in order to avoid the effects of your shakes. Don't think you can stand on a vibrating steel plate to test the anti-shake. This is for us old folk who aren't as steady as we once were. This camera can do everything except miracles, so don't go out of your way to push its limits.Which is just what I plan to do in the coming months. Maybe I will report back with updates. I am finding it AUTO's to an incredible depth of field. I can focus on something close (like the ingredient list on the soy sauce bottle at the restaurant) and find what is much further behind still in focus. I am certain you can tweak it if you want a very short depth of field, perhaps simply by pulling way back to widescreen.The color is true and very good. And the short film I tried out came out very well, as clear as the still shots with good front to back focus, and the microphone (as well as the speaker on playback) are incredibly sensitive.You can do a lot of things with this camera's on-board photo-processing lab, including Black and White and Sepia, and vivid colors, as if the true colors were not fantastic already. The 110 page User's Manual which comes with it tells you much, if not all, quite clearly, considering. It indicates to me there is much more to this wonderful camera than I am aware of, and I plan to study it closely.I thought I was just grabbing an emergency, inexpensive point-and-shoot to get an assignment done. It turns out I got one truly great camera with far more capabilities than I am aware of, and I hope to grow into them all.This should to turn out to be one very beautiful relationship.

Reviews.Title: What a camera!
Reviews.Author: Buddha Sun "May the Chi be with you!"
Reviews.Content: I nover thought that I would buy a digital camera, but when I looked at this one, I gave it a try. It is the envy of all those in my family that have digital cameras! It is excellent!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good deal
Reviews.Author: Lil writer "book worm"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last year to take holiday photos and i haven't stopped using it since. It didn't really cut into my budget because i got at a really good price despite its many functions. It takes really good pictures. It's very efficient and easy to use. The zoom function for instance, i can take good pictures no matter how far i am and they still end up looking really good. Its size is also another thing i was pleased with, its the right size to carry around in my pocket and not too small to easily lose.Its aesthetically pleasing to the eye although i found that it's not in a lot of colors which was a little dissapointing. Its color range isn't wide enough although the ones that they do have are appealing. I would recommend this camera to those people who like to take pictures at get togethers or just parties with friends.

Reviews.Title: l18 coolpix
Reviews.Author: Andrew G. Roetting
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera for my wife, but have used it and really appreciate the compact size, menu options, and the quality of the prints.  I have an olympus SP-510-UZ and can say print quality is par with my camera.  It sure is nice to have a pocket camera to tag along.

Reviews.Title: Good Deal
Reviews.Author: Miriam W. Jocks
Reviews.Content: This camera was a Christmas present, and it was a very good deal. Several people in my family have one, because it's so easy to use, and the fact that we can get these with different colored casings keeps us from mixing them up. The large screen is useful if you have low vision (or are starting to need reading glasses).

Reviews.Title: Great Nikon Coolpix
Reviews.Author: T. Powell "Real Music Lover"
Reviews.Content: I've never has my own camera so I wanted to start out with a great one.  I chose the Nikon Coolpix and I'm glad I chose it.  I am very pleased and I'm sure you will be too.

Reviews.Title: red coolpix
Reviews.Author: Ernie S. Early
Reviews.Content: i think this product is very nice and can't wait to (master) the loads of features; so far the 2gb memory works well. oh and it's my son who is the photographer.

Reviews.Title: BIG BLUE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: P. J. Hamilton "dragon lover"
Reviews.Content: THE NIKON COOLPIX L18 8MP DIGITAL CAMERA IS GREAT.  I CALL HIM BIG BLUE AND HE GIVES BEAUTIFUL PICTURES.  IT IS SO EASY MY GRANDDAUGHTER AND TAKES BETTER PICTURES THAN I DO.  THE WHOLE FAMILY USES HIM.  I DID GET A 4GB MEDIA CARD SO WE CAN KEEP TAKING PICTURES FOR A LONG TIME BEFORE WE HAVE TO DOWNLOAD.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: K. Michaud
Reviews.Content: This camera was a perfect present for my mum who wanted a small and easy-to-use camera. The size was perfect - can fit into a pocket, even, and my technologically-impaired mum figured out all the instructions in just an hour or two! Lets anyone have fun with digital photography.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Forrester, found
Reviews.Content: My first digital camera so I'm mostly comparing it to my conventional Pentax and making observations on it's ease of use and practicality. It takes nice clear pictures in virtually any light. What you see is the picture you get. I've been taking pictures outside in sun and overcast conditions and indoor pictures, and they all come out well. It is very easy to use and I like the fact that it uses conventional AAA batteries which can be purchased cheaply. (When I was buying a storage card for it that was how the clerk identified the model so I'm guessing that is a popular feature.) Overall, it is a nice camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix
Reviews.Author: B. Park
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this camera!!.  I purchased this as a xmas gift and was unsure of the quality but needless to say my daughter can not put it down.  The batteries have held up well considering the use.  We got her the reuseable  batteries and a charger.

Reviews.Title: Even my Mother in law loves this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Charles Cummins "Astrochuckie"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for Wifey's mother. She loves it and can actually understand how to use it! This means she doesn't call us all the time for support! What a dream! Fast shipping from Amazon and very well packed.I might get one for myself!

Reviews.Title: A good camera, cool too!
Reviews.Author: Chet E. McCracken
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 of these. 1 for my wife and 1 for my sister-in-law. They love them. They work well, are small and the pictures are great......well recommended.....

Reviews.Title: Nikon L18 Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Coe "nurse"
Reviews.Content: Great camera with so many features for the price I have barely gotten to enjoy a fraction of what is possible

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L18 Camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia Jensen
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  It is the fourth Coolpix Camera that we have purchased.  It works great, is easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L18
Reviews.Author: Susan Ibanez "avid reader"
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix L18 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Navy)Lots of MP's here, but some disappointment too.  Cameral takes AA batteries, handy, but it drains them fast!  Shutter has a long lag time, which makes shots of children playing impossible in the automatic setting.  For kids, use the sports mode which is still has some shutter lag, or use a flash to freeze the action.

Reviews.Title: Love the Nikon!
Reviews.Author: Busy Mom "Karen"
Reviews.Content: We originally bought it as a gift for Grandmom, but she got a different one. We gave it to our son and he LOVES it. Easy to use. Large clear screen. Even the movie part works very well. We'd buy again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas A. Zulli "Tazz"
Reviews.Content: I needed a new digital camera bad, the one I had only had 4.1 megapixels. I did some researching based on my price range and found this camera. I noticed it got mix reviews mostly very positive. Since it was exactly what I needed, I bought it.It turned out to be better then I expected. Quality is great, it has a camcorder with sound (my old one didnt have sound) and its easy to use. Its worth whatever you spend

Reviews.Title: Good camera for an active teenager.
Reviews.Author: Matthew J. Basile "Big Boy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 17 year old daughter just to carry around with her when she's with friends. She loves it. Pictures are clear and bright. Full of color. Very good camera for the price. She loves the red color.

Reviews.Title: Still learning
Reviews.Author: Mary Gay Bennett
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything. I am still learning how to use it. Will take time and practice for me. I highley recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jen "5980"
Reviews.Content: Like others, I had problems with the camera draining the batteries. When not in use, I advise to take the batteries out of the camera. Other than that, it's been great.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Camera - great value
Reviews.Author: Gail A. Betts
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas. She loves it.  The pictures seem to come out very clear and it's easy to use. She is currently traveling to New Zealand and Australia and wanted a nice camera to capture the sights out there. She is very happy with the quality of this product.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L18 CoolPix Digital Camera in Red
Reviews.Author: J. Schiavone "Judy"
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera, and I love it.  It takes great pictures, was very reasonably priced, and is so cute in red.  It is very user friendly, and has a lot of great features (such as a 3" LDC screen), for a simple point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix camera review
Reviews.Author: C. Egan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift for my 15 yr old son and for my 26 yr old son. They both love it, it takes great pictures for a pocket camera. They are both happy with it, haven't heard any complaints, and the price was good. My 26 yr old has had many cameras and he says his is just what he was looking for, it is a replacement camera for him, so I guess that's the best recommendation. Good camera for the price. Clear pictures and easy to take. If you are looking for a camera for someone who just wants to take fun pictures and who is not a professional,this is a great camera. And like I said, the price is good.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Linard7
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 10 year old daughter for Christmas.  This is super easy to use, just point and shoot.  Takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Worth more than I paid.
Reviews.Author: Sheila Miel
Reviews.Content: So I spent alot of time researching my camera before I purchased it because I was very happy with the digital camera I purchased 8 years ago so I was very careful.  I was not giving up a good camera for a good camera..I wanted a great camera.  My old camera took forever to load between pictures (which I saw as I was researching is the command complaint for older cameras) so that was one of my number one concerns also I am a very big scrapbooker and I wanted to make sure that I could enlarge pictures easily to 8x10 or crop without a problem.  I had a budget of $150 and I spent only $90 and I believe that it was so worth it.  I have taken through the holidays around 200 to 300 pictures and used the video feature.  I have uploaded the video for family to see presents being opened at Christmas and I have printed around 200 of the pictures and I very happy with the quality of what I have, no problem with enlargements or cropping.  Very good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice point n shot cam with energy consumption fault
Reviews.Author: Alex Wei "Matrix2000"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera during the Thanksgiving sales.  Very good value with its price. And the brand Nikon also has value. color is ok (I took two years of photograhy in college), sharpness is good and I like the contrast.The large LCD screen is its main value; But it eats battery like crazy. It consumes one pair of AA batteries in a day of shooting of around 50-60 pictures and 2 videos. I paid $89.00 for the cam, but I expect another $89.00 for the battery soon.

Reviews.Title: Very good basic camera
Reviews.Author: Nice Guy
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that the camera uses a AA battery and has a view finder.  Although the screen is great, I occasionally like to use a view finder.Had a Canon A530 before (until it was accidentally ruined).  Like the smaller size and the bigger screen of the Nikon.The delay between the flash and the picture gives subjects time to close their eyes.

Reviews.Title: very slow shutter speed
Reviews.Author: Tammy Peterson
Reviews.Content: nikon makes very good camaras. the only problem i have with my camara is the shutter speed is very slow. by the time the pic is taken the moment has passed. otherwise very nice camara.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix is Cool!!!
Reviews.Author: S. V. Barone
Reviews.Content: The Nikon Coolpix L18, is a great starter camera for the serious picture taker! With 8 Megapixels and 3x optical zoom, it helps the casaual photographer to aspire to better hieghts! Could be more useful with a rechargable lithium-type battery as it does run through the standard AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix is so easy
Reviews.Author: E. Gallagher
Reviews.Content: This camera is so easy to use - it's great.  It was a Christmas present for my 13 year old daughter.  She was thrilled with it - just popped in the batteries (which were included) and started taking pictures.  The pictures came out clear and sharp.  The next day we took a trip to Hershey and took more pictures on the Chocolate World tour - also great.  I'd recommend this for an easy point and shoot digital camera.

Reviews.Title: don't cry over a broken camera
Reviews.Author: Janice Brown
Reviews.Content: I was very upset when I realized that my digital camera was broken and that it would cost more to fix it than to get a new one. I looked around my town and Wal Mart had the Nikon Coolpix on sale for $99.  I checked Amazon,found it for $87 and no shipping costs.  Then when I received it, took some pictures, I was astounded by the clarity of the photo, the ease to operate the camera and the color red.  I was very happy. I wish I could attach the first photo I took of my Black Lab in the first snow of the season. It was my  Christmas card this year.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Marti Melville
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras as gifts.  I wasn't disappointed.  This little camera is able to take great digital photos.  I've been very satisfied with my purchace and the recipients were thrilled.I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for an easy camera to use with quality photos at a price that can't be beat.Marti MelvilleAuthor of Deja vu: Farraige[...]

Reviews.Title: RECEIVED THE CAMERA BROKEN AND NOT ABLE TO GET A NEW ONE
Reviews.Author: L. Espada
Reviews.Content: I SEND A $200 CAMERA AS A BIRTHDAY GIFT TO MY 16 YEAR OLD NIECE. THE CAMERA NEVER WORKED, IT ARRIVED BROKEN BUT I AM NOT ABLE TO GET A NEW ONE BECAUSE I STILL (1 MONTH LATER) DON'T HAVE AND INVOICE WHICH SHOWS THE DATE OF PERCHUSE.THIS IS THE SECOND TIME DOME SIMILAR HAPPENDS, I WILL NEVER BUY ON AMAZON AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: Flawed picture quality
Reviews.Author: N. Franklin
Reviews.Content: I took pictures of my artwork with the Nikon but I had a problem with the way the pictures were coming out. I tried again and again but each time certain areas of the picture came out faded. I had an earlier model of this camera before and it worked just fine, but in this case I had to return the camera. I guess in this case it was probably just my bad luck that I got a dud.I was told that Canon has a better quality lenses and a better reputation in general, so I returned the Nikon and got a similar sized Canon. Amazon made it easy to return the Nikon and didn't make me pay for postage or a "repackaging" fee. The Canon arrived in a few days. It isn't quite as small, sleek, and sexy, but it takes fine pictures without any fading or distortion.

Reviews.Title: Nice photos, while it lasts
Reviews.Author: S. D Shearman "SShearman"
Reviews.Content: I owned this camera for about a month and really liked it--good shots, fairly good speed, excellent review quality on the huge LCD. and face recognition focus. It even allows you to zoom in/out while you are acquiring video; My older sony won't let you do that.Huge LCD, low cost, 8MP, what's not to like?After about a month of use, a small black "crouton" something broke off or came loose inside the camera lens assembly. It positioned itself just on the back of the lens, so that future shots all included a photo of the backside.

Reviews.Title: HIGHLY Dissappointed
Reviews.Author: laltuna
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product "used" and was told it was in good condition. When taking pictures the camera performs normally and the pics are ok however, when taking videos is another story. The videos are NO GOOD. I purchased this prior to going on vacations to St. Maarten. I filmed a great group of teens playing steel drums. I thought this was going to be such a great memory of my 9th year wedding celebration trip. What a great disappointment when I've got home and tried playing the video. The sound was very distorted and the quality of video was very poor. The vendor should have known this and should have never sold this camera. Or at least give warning about the fact that the video although it works is totally useless.

Reviews.Title: hate it
Reviews.Author: leann
Reviews.Content: READ THIS REVIEW BEFORE YOU EVEN THINK OF BUYING THIS CAMERA. ITS FOR YOUR OWN GOOD----------------------------------it seemed good at first but now i hate it. the picture quality is horrible. on other cameras I've tried, when in the dark, the flash makes the picture more clear and brighter, but using this camera, it look like someone put a thin white layer over the picture...its horrible. i've been using software like photoshop for quite some time so im pretty good at using it. when i edit other pictures they turn fine but when i try to edit a picture that was taken by this camera, it just doesnt workout. the picture doesnt get any better. also, i hate taking pictures of myself or other people, it makes your skin look so oily and your hair look greecy and it makes you look tired. if you having anything like a pimple on your face, it comes out very noticeable.another thing that bothers me is the focus. it takes too long to focus, when im taking a picture with someone, i have to wait so long, then if the picture doesnt come out good, i have to wait again for the camera to take the picture. when my friends ask me to take their picture using their camera, it takes no time at all. i dont have to wait for it to focus, it takes the picture right away plus the picture quality turns out very well. it looks just like the real scene.someone else i hate about the camera is the sound quality of videos. i took this camera to a rock concert, when i uploaded the video to my computer, i couldnt even hear what song it was. and at the concert, i was very close to the stage and speaker. at first i thought it was because of the screaming audience but it wasnt. it partially was because of them but i should i still been able to hear the band. i tested out the sound by playing a song on itunes then recording it. the sound was horrible. there was this extra noice in the background, it sounded like a mess and i was in a quiet room.FOR YOUR OWN GOOD, DO NOT BUT THIS CAMERA. IT IS NOT WORTH THE MONEY, I WOULDNT EVEN BUY A CAMERA LIKE THIS FOR $40.-----------------------------

Reviews.Title: Anyone care about the slowness? Anoying button
Reviews.Author: Athlonnx
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for over a year.  I got it for $130.  This was to replace an old Kodak 4 mega pixel 2003 camera that was like a brick.  Overall, I think my old Kodak was better than this camera....The camera does have some positive attributes, such as the large LCD screen.  If you want the pros on this thing, just read all the other reviews.  People really like this camera for some reason.Bottomline, I have 2 major problems with this camera:1.  It takes forever to take a picture.  Notice that none of the other positive reviews note how long it takes to take a picture.  It's S-L-O-W.  It's slow when starting-up.  Need to capture that fleeting precious moment?  Forget it, by the time this thing boots-up...  The other problem is that the camera has some sort of sensor.  When taking a picture, the yellow light activates (scans the area?) and blinks a few times, after a few seconds, it finally takes the picture.  You can forget about taking a consecutive picture quickly.2.  Actually pressing the button to take the picture.  If you don't press the button just right, it will not take the picture.  Instead, the yellow light will blink and no picture will be taken.  This is considered a feature.  Don't quite understand why.Other people have used my camera and they hate it.I really don't understand why most of the reviewers like this camera.

Reviews.Title: If a warranty matters - Stay away Nikon
Reviews.Author: FKT Engineering
Reviews.Content: We bought the Red L18 On Dec 16 2008.  On Feb 14 2009 the lens jammed when extending.  I don't know why, it just did.  I sent it in for warranty repair.  Nikon Service imformed my that it was not under warranty because of an impact, or scratch on the body of the camera.  Unless air can impact or scratch the camera, I have no clue what caused the impact.  I will never touch another Nikon product.It was a nice little camera, but obvously it is far too fragile to take outside.  If you plan on taking it out of the box to actually us it, use it with extreme care.My Canon cameras have been dropped, sat upon, left in the hot sun for hours and they work fine.  I can't even begin to say how disgusted I am with Nikon.Beware...

Reviews.Title: better nikon
Reviews.Author: R. Korzeniewski "korz"
Reviews.Content: This is an improvement from the slider functions selector - you change from picture to movie thru a menu button choice. I think it's better.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Low Quality
Reviews.Author: Christine Ama
Reviews.Content: I have had many Nikon SLR's over the years and have always found them to be made well and a great quality product. Like most reviewers, I have found the CoolPix L18 to be a great point and shoot camera, Unfortunately, the quality of this one does not hold up to my view of Nikon cameras. The Display started to act flaky (occasional flicker) just after a few months of use and eventually quit all together.  Like other reviewers with nikon service issues, Nikon was reluctant to stand behind its product even tho obviously defective, I will consider a different brand with better customer service for my next purchase. Takes great pictures, low quality components...

Reviews.Title: Great "companion" camera
Reviews.Author: SpeedoNJ "Len"
Reviews.Content: I love point-and-shoots and have no desire at this point to get intoDSLR, and this LITTLE thing works great to have with you all the time.  I have bigger P&S; from the other mfgs (and Nikon) that do very well but you can't carry them around in  your pocket like this one.Have a Fuji A500 which did just average, this one is much clearer, LCD is huge in comparison, pictures are not grainy.So for that time when you say "I wish I had my camera with me" get this and keep it by your side at all times (or use it everyday for all your pictures) and you'll be ready. And it comes in red or blue-- no more boring silver or black only.

Reviews.Title: Hugely disappointed
Reviews.Author: Janie Jones "Montana Gal"
Reviews.Content: I just bought two of these for grad presents for my twin daughters. I wanted to take a few pictures just to make sure they would be all right. I took pics inside, outside, at a few different settings, close up, zoom. They looked fine when reviewing them on the camera but when I downloaded them onto the computer THEY WERE AWFUL. Even just a normal close up picture is horrible. They are so grainy I can't believe it. I would expect better quality from a disposible. I will be returning these and looking at the Canons.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix L18 *MP Digital
Reviews.Author: Terri Wallace "reader"
Reviews.Content: Great Camera for the money. Nice big screen.Easy to use. I would totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Decent Product for the Price
Reviews.Author: KeyboardIsMightier
Reviews.Content: I purchased two Nikon Coolpix L18 years ago and found the product to be average for the price.  It has a pretty good zoom for a point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: B. Anderson "champaign super nova"
Reviews.Content: Ordered many years ago and just now getting around to review. Iphone sare all the rage now, no need for this.

Reviews.Title: Worthless Cra*
Reviews.Author: S. Fisher
Reviews.Content: I bought a brand new Nikon l-18 to take with me to my Vacation to the Philippines, it worked fine in the begining but after shooting #85 pics every other picture was out of focus. the red square would light up then the green when I took the pic it was blurry. Luckly for me I had my Fuji-film f650 also with me and It shot great pictures to bad it was a 6 mgp.

Reviews.Title: Really bad shots in the night
Reviews.Author: Amit Wadhwa
Reviews.Content: The camera works great during daytime but night shots are really blurry. I actually bought a Sony W-150 for myself after this purchase and have kept this as a backup.

Reviews.Title: very slow
Reviews.Author: Mar "Marinera"
Reviews.Content: i own this for 1 week and return, nice colorful pictures. but so slow i dont have the patients for it.

Reviews.Title: Fairly good camera
Reviews.Author: Marisa Bohar
Reviews.Content: I was super excited to get this camera as an upgrade to my last one. I gotta tell ya, I was somewhat disappointed with how slow the camera actually snaps a picture from when you click the button. I mainly take pictures of my neices and nephew and I have gotten some profile shots on accident because the picture didn't take fast enough. I am open to suggestions on how to fix this. Another thing is that the camera always seems to drain batteries very quickly. After one use I the battery is half or more used. I am also open to any suggestions there. Otherwise worth the small price I had to pay.

Reviews.Title: Regular cam
Reviews.Author: Guilherme Mello
Reviews.Content: The lenses and the shooting waiting time are litle below a sony in the same price range....Everything else is fine. Good value

Reviews.Title: Bad luck
Reviews.Author: Silver Mouse
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in December 2008 and in January 09 the screen burned out. I just returned the camera for repair. It takes great pictures. A lots of features. I guess I got a lemon (it was made on friday afternoon). Not only this camera but all digital cameras you must buy a memory card if you want to take more than 20 pictures. Waiting to get it back.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Steven Dennis "bnstruk"
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this product. I haven't got my pictures developed yet but it did seem a little blurry when taking pictures around fifteen feet away. But other than that I very much like my camera.And very nice considering the price. So all in all very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: IAMTHEIAM
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my Mother because it has easy mode and real easy mode.The only draw back is the two AA batteries do not last very long at all.Wish it had a lithium ion battery pack like the previous Nikon i had, but get the rechargeable AA batteries seem to work well.It takes a great picture and has quite a few options and a big LED screen is what she like about it.Good camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L. Stulz
Reviews.Content: This camera's lens broke 3rd week we had it! Beware - you get what you pay for and in digital cameras this is a cheapie.

Reviews.Title: DOA - Nikon Warranty Service was Fast - about 3 weeks, same unit returned
Reviews.Author: Learnfrom Myexperience
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a graduation present. Sent it off to college - it did not work. I tried to get it to work later and it 'takes' a picture but nothing goes to any memory (internal or SD card). I missed the return window by 3 days, with vacations and all. Perhaps a reminder that local brick and mortar stores are much better at this sort of event than packaging and shipping to an ether-store. I'll update this after I learn how Nikon treats me. - UPDATE: Nikon service was relatively fast - It was not clear to me that the warranty service was indeed free since you sort of blindly send the camera off and then they bill you 'no charge' later. It is working well. Some additional info: the camera apparently has no actual optical or electronic image stabilization ability - it just kicks the shutter speed up if it believes motion is occuring. A bit unclear in the description that it does this - FYI...

Reviews.Title: I ditto EVERYTHING Marjorie and Anon. Shop Had to say... DON'T buy EVEN if on sale!!!
Reviews.Author: T. Alleyne
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give it "NO STARS." You will be very disappointed.  I returned it to Ritz Camera when I came back from a trip.  The time it takes for the camara to take another picture.. the moment has been lost.  A very, very long time to take the next picture.  The pictures were horrible!  Just plain horrible!  I'm going to stick with my husband's Canon Proshot 870.  A much better camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L18
Reviews.Author: Santiago J. Baraoidan
Reviews.Content: Can't give a review at this moment. Receive camera on the 29th Mar., took 21 days to get here in Hawaii. Had to send it to Nikon Service Center on 1st of April to be repaired.

Reviews.Title: coolpix
Reviews.Author: David R. Stowe "David Stowe"
Reviews.Content: Item was itended to be a gift to our military serving son. Nice company to work with. They were very helpful. . .Still the item never arrived and as of now it's location is unknown. The people have tried everything to help me so I guess that is the way it goes.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Remy
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for about two weeks daily now for work. I hate every second I spend behind this piece of junk. It will over-expose and blowout almost every photo you take unless it's not sunny outside and then you get blurry photos from the slower shutter speed. Also, don't even get me started on the terrible auto-focus system. The focus bracket is in the center of the image, but don't think that's where it will focus all of the time. It would regularly focus on something in the background or foreground and I would have no idea because the bracket stays in the center. The macro mode is terrible as well, it says it will focus up to 5" (which is weak in its own right), but I couldn't get it to focus sometimes as far away as 10-12" on some photos. I am planning on returning it tomorrow and going back to my Canon A620 which takes much better photos in bright sunlight which is what I need.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Andrea Grieser "apg"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on Dec. 22 as a gift for my son.  We brought it on vacation, and by Dec. 28 it stopped working.  The display monitor wouldn't display a picture any more.  I never dropped it, never manhandled it, and was always careful with it.  My son was, too, as I taught him to always wear the camera strap on his wrist to avoid accidentally dropping it, and I always observed him using it, and he was very careful.  Nevertheless, the display doesn't work anymore, and since it doesn't have a viewfinder, I now have a $100 paperweight, as Best Buy told me it was "accidental" damage, even though I had no accident with it.  I guess I'll try sending it to Nikon, though am not happy that I have to pay all the postage for their junky product, and if they decide it's an "accident," I'll get no help there either.The picture quality was ok (though there were a bunch of blurry ones for no reason I can figure out and some with streak marks), but I didn't expect too much because of the price.  Never going with Nikon again, though.  If you decide to buy this anyway, be sure NOT to get it from Best Buy, as they don't stand behind their products unless you buy their ridiculously overpriced warranty plans.  Maybe they buy junk on purpose hoping you'll buy their warranty plans (which by the way aren't that great since we had one on a laptop from them and it took them forever to fix it each time it broke).

Reviews.Title: This is the worst camera I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Brian S. Mccarthy
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon L18 specifcally over other compact digital's beacuseof it's AA batteries. That was a mistake. Using the manufacturer'sbatteries and charger, if I put a fully charged set of batteries in onSaturday, and turn the camera on on Monday, I'm rewarded with "Batteryexhausted". Alkalines work better, but not much.When combined with transfer software that can only be described as lame,compared to the typical "appears as drive d:" camera interface (You can'ttransfer from the camera except via this special application), thiscamera is junk to be avoided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: Customer Beware
Reviews.Author: Brody
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera, as a gift, from one of the Amazon vendors, Vanns.  It arrived defective and Vanns was unwilling or unable to replace it.  Amazon was also unwilling to replace it, and I was told that I would have to get a credit from Vanns and then re-order it from another vendor.  Apparently, Amazon does not stand behind its vendors...you are on your own.  The right thing for Amazon to do, since this camera is sold by several vendors on the Amazon site and I used my credit card to pay Amazon, would be to get me another camera, from another vendor.  My relationship should be with Amazon, not its myriad vendors that I don't know.  So, beware when ordering from a vendor.  Amazon will not help you if it's defective.

Reviews.Title: Returned Item
Reviews.Author: Pauliina J. Torres "paulina"
Reviews.Content: Unhappy with camera. I needed more Optical Zoom (soon realized after I bought the camera). Pictures were not clear, had to retake several before I got a clear one. Not expensive, but you get what you pay for. I would probably suggest it for a young kid, my 12 year old loved it.

Reviews.Title: not good camera at all!
Reviews.Author: mom of 6
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera and it was horrible. the quality of the pictures where not good! i didnt have a good experience with it i would suggest not buying it!!!

ProductInfo.Features:
8.0-megapixel resolution for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches
3x optical zoom;  Anti-Shake AE mode
